intro: Sida ecornis, commonly known as the cottonweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in dry, open areas and has small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish, and it produces fluffy, seed-filled capsules. Sida ecornis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions.
